title: Web Development
desc: Web development is the process of creating websites and web applications for the internet or an intranet. It involves a range of tasks, from designing the layout and user interface to coding the functionality and interactivity of the site. Web development can be broadly categorized into three areas: front-end development, back-end development, and full-stack development.

summary.desc: In this unit, you will learn how to create visually appealing and interactive web pages using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You'll also get an introduction to popular front-end frameworks and tools to enhance your development process.
points: HTML: Basic structure and common tags , Forms and input elements ,Semantic HTML
CSS: Styling text and layouts , Flexbox and Grid , Responsive design and media queries
JavaScript: Variables, data types, and operators , Functions, loops, and conditionals , DOM manipulation and event handling
Frameworks and Libraries: Introduction to jQuery , Overview of React, Angular, or Vue.js

learnings.desc: Front-end development focuses on creating the visual and interactive elements of websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You'll learn how to design responsive and user-friendly interfaces, as well as explore modern frameworks like React or Vue.js.

content.text: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language used to create and design web pages. It structures content on the web by using elements like headings, paragraphs, links, images, and forms. Each HTML element is represented by tags, usually consisting of an opening and closing tag that enclose the content. HTML is the foundation of web development, allowing browsers to interpret and display content correctly. It's often used alongside CSS (for styling) and JavaScript (for interactivity) to build dynamic and visually appealing websites, making it an essential skill for web developers.

html 2 Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.., comes from a line in section 1.10.32.The standard chunk of Lorem Ipsum used since the 1500s is reproduced below for those interested. Sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 from de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum by Cicero are also reproduced in their exact original form, accompanied by English versions from the 1914 translation by H. Rackham
